channel.title: [TUT] How To Set Up A Proxy
channel.description:
Hi,
This is the first tutorial i have submited to the community but i hope that some people out there find it usefull, Masking your IP is a usefull Ability that will stop you getting your IP banned.
Please reply with coments on this tutorial and if it was any help :)
[TUT] How to set up a proxy using IE by Blackhat
Now were to start, ok.. lets start at the first step.
Step (one) Find a anonymous proxy server.
There are millions of proxy's to choose from but we are looking for a anonymous proxy or High anonymous. I belive a transparent proxy will not mask your ip.
It may take a few attempts to find a working proxy because most block Runescape and do wierd things with google, but keep trying untill you find one that works with runescape, but for now just pick one from this list and go onto step two. (http://www.proxy4free.com/page1.html)
Step (two)
Open IE (internet explorer) and click on "tools/internet options" then click the "connections" Tab. If you are using dial up click on "settings" if you are using broadband click on "LAN settings" Now check the "proxy server" radio button to display 2 new fields one is address and the other is port. Enter the ip address you got from step one and the port and click o.k/apply/ok. [img]http://blackhatproxy.jpg[/img]
Step (three)
Close IE and reopen it now go to google and see what language it is in or try runescape. You will soon know it is working! (alert: Runescape will auto pick wierd worlds based on the country of the proxy computer u are using).
Hope this helps, Now if you get banned, u will only lose one account :)
Kind Regards, [move]~o0o\BlacKhat/o0o~[/move]

item.title: [TUT] How To Set Up A Proxy
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

[quote=“Kalphiter, post:7, topic:1000”][quote author=daiki link=topic=920.msg8680#msg8680 date=1143979904]
The world suggestion is HTTP based, so any HTTP proxy will make it suggest worlds by the proxy.

But if the “last logged in from” part in the game changes then it should work.
[/quote]Most proxy servers do this to files:

(anything in the HTML would become…)
Such as: http://www.runescape.com/runescape.jar
Would become: http://proxylocation/index.php?(some random code).jar

Most proxies convert every link.[/quote]
You’re an idiot.

Read full topic
item.source: [TUT] How To Set Up A Proxy

item.title: [TUT] How To Set Up A Proxy
item.dc:creator: @blackhat blackhat
item.description:
@blackhat wrote:

the last ip will still change in the java applet as far a i am aware, the java applet still connect via the prozy you can see this buy the worlds that runescape auto choses for you ROFL use a mexican proxy server and the best world for you to play in will be mexico according to RS (and that show that it must work, i think anyway... lol).
Correct me if i am wrong,

BTW, how do i put my pic i attached into the spot i have in the body of the tutorial Daiki,
(i used to know a tibetin nun and her ordanded name was daiki.. lol)[br][size=1]Posted at: April 02, 2006, 05:01:24 am[/size][hr]Confermed to still block ip in java applet!

Read full topic

The actual RuneScape client that runs through Java will not use the proxy, so Jagex can still see where you play from. Right?

Or does the "last logged in from:" ip change?

item.title: [TUT] How To Set Up A Proxy
item.dc:creator: @blackhat blackhat
item.description:
@blackhat wrote:

Hi,

This is the first tutorial i have submited to the community but i hope that some people out there find it usefull, Masking your IP is a usefull Ability that will stop you getting your IP banned.

Please reply with coments on this tutorial and if it was any help

[TUT] How to set up a proxy using IE
by Blackhat

Now were to start, ok.. lets start at the first step.

Step (one)
Find a anonymous proxy server.

There are millions of proxy's to choose from but we are looking for a anonymous proxy or High anonymous.
I belive a transparent proxy will not mask your ip.

It may take a few attempts to find a working proxy because most block Runescape and do wierd things with google, but keep trying untill you find one that works with runescape, but for now just pick one from this list and go onto step two.
(http://www.proxy4free.com/page1.html)

Step (two)

Open IE (internet explorer) and click on "tools/internet options" then click the "connections" Tab.
If you are using dial up click on "settings" if you are using broadband click on "LAN settings"
Now check the "proxy server" radio button to display 2 new fields one is address and the other is port.
Enter the ip address you got from step one and the port and click o.k/apply/ok.

Step (three)

Close IE and reopen it now go to google and see what language it is in or try runescape. You will soon know it is working! (alert: Runescape will auto pick wierd worlds based on the country of the proxy computer u are using).

Hope this helps,
Now if you get banned, u will only lose one account

Kind Regards,
[move]~o0o\BlacKhat/o0o~[/move]
